definition: to agree (to do sth)/to promise
surname Ying
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
to promise readily

sentences.english: The British Embassy arranged for me to leave Japan as soon as promised.
sentences.chinese: 英國駐日大使館應承儘快安排我撤離日本。

sentences.english: We considered gravely before giving our consent.
sentences.chinese: 我們經過慎重考慮後才應承此事。

sentences.english: I take it you don't consent.
sentences.chinese: 這麼說來，我以爲你是不應承。
這位寡婦母親毫不猶豫的應承了。

sentences.english: And Samson said unto them, Swear unto me, that ye will not fall upon me yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 參孫說，你們要向我起誓，應承你們自己不害死我。

sentences.english: Kids have a strategy called "promise everything first, think of it later".
sentences.chinese: 小孩們有自己的策略，“應承所有的東西，到時先算。

sentences.english: Three people to make fox blunt talk directly and her down.
sentences.chinese: 三人一聽令狐沖說話便直接應承下來。

definition: to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to act in a play/to put on a play
helper/assistant
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
unwilling
critical/crucial/vital
to know/to reprimand/to urge/to long for/to tell/to inform
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to be mistreated/to be bullied
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
joking matter/to go back on one's words
actual situation/truth
sooner or later
different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
